ignore.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to deliberately pay no attention to something that you have been told or that you know about
ignore.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: You can’t ignore the fact that many criminals never go to prison.
problems which we can’t afford to ignore
ignore.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something
ignore.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The phone rang, but she ignored it.
He had completely ignored her remark, preferring his own theory.
ignore.translation[0].definitions[1].not: In everyday British English, people often say take no notice of something or not take any notice of something rather than ignore something:
There are signs telling you not to smoke, but people don’t take any notice of them.
